Posts.Content:
Hi Merrida-
When I was younger, I had the same characteristics as you describe...fibro cystic with some calcifications. 
I'm now 71 and was told a while ago that the fibro cystic issue no longer existed. No mention of anything but "normal" for years. That's why this situation took me by surprise.
Thanks for the info and assurances.
I got out my mp3 player with meditation messages and will take any "relaxing" med they offer. Tolerated colonoscopies every 6 months for a while so I guess I can deal with this.

Franny-
Just reread your post and was reminded that the woman who was ahead of me (in line for second mammos) was told that she had calcifications and needed to come back in 6 months. 
Made me wonder if the the whole "second mammo, biopsy process" was a new way for docs to earn more $ in light of the Medicare payment reductions. (I've noticed recently that docs are calling for more expensive tests than in the past.)
Did a little research and found this informative website:
http://www.hopkinsbreastcenter.org/artemis/200102/feature13.html
Interesting info.
